basics.name: Jiecheng Lu
basics.summary: Ph.D. student in Machine Learning at Georgia Tech (Advisor: Shihao Yang). Research interests include foundation models, next‑generation sequence modeling for NLP/CV/time series, and linear attention mechanisms. Reviewer service: NeurIPS 2024 & 2025, ICLR 2025, ICML 2025, and IEEE Internet of Things Journal.

work.company: Tencent (Tencent Medical AI Lab - JARVIS Lab)
work.summary: Developed deep learning/statistical models and co-authored publications & patents for medical time-series applications.
highlights: Co-authored 2 papers on medical time series models and filed 6 patents as lead inventor.
Built models for medical insurance forecasting and epidemic monitoring.
Delivered tech solutions for medical facilities in 4 major cities, handling up to 10 million data points daily.

work.summary: Applied ML and causal inference for cost analysis; built AWS-based dashboards to support sourcing decisions.
highlights: Improved sourcing performance via data-driven methods for cost analysis.
Developed AWS-based dashboard web apps that helped save over $100,000 per month.

work.summary: Contributed to projects in supply chain finance, risk hedging, and logistics network design.
highlights: Worked with stochastic programming, game theory, and structural equation models using CPLEX, Stata, AMOS, and Python.

publications.name: ZeroS: Zero‑Sum Linear Attention for Efficient Transformer
Linear Transformers as VAR Models: Aligning Autoregressive Attention Mechanisms with Autoregressive Forecasting
WAVE: Weighted Autoregressive Varying Gate for Time Series Forecasting
CATS: Enhancing Multivariate Time Series Forecasting by Constructing Auxiliary Time Series as Exogenous Variables
ARM: Refining Multivariate Forecasting with Adaptive Temporal‑Contextual Learning
